intro: Burckella banikiensis, commonly known as the Banikiensis burckella, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a woody stem with hairy leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
